Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Added null checks to mitigate exceptions on the '/profiles' pages" (#9388) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The `/profiles` pages use the same js script as the search page, but do not have a `searchForm` element on the page, so we were getting exceptions from the javascript on the `/profiles` pages when we tried to reference the form elements.

I've now added checks in the script so that we do not reference anything that doesn't exist on the page.

I also removed a helper method that was not being used by the search page anymore (`AddSortByOption()`).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Search page A11y fixes" (#9387) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
1. This PR fixes an accessibility issue where, when the TFM section was collapsed and there were very few search results on the page, the black text of some of the TFM checkbox labels could overlap with the dark blue footer background (even though the checkboxes were not visible), causing a contrast issue on A11y FastPass. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/218198449-23ec3954-7e64-46d7-8347-5df58ac1b18e.png)
We now flip the TFM tab's `display` property between `'none'` and `'block'` when it is collapsed or expanded. This also means we don't need to manually toggle `tabindex` for the checkboxes when the section is collapsed or expanded.

2. The text we show when there's 0 package results also has an a11y issue, where it shouldn't have the `aria-expanded` property. I've removed that now.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/218199365-a21f5d7f-675f-4bd4-8879-6cbbb23fa11a.png)

3. I've also removed an unused ViewModel property (`ShouldDisplayAdvancedSearchPanel`).

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Fix two small UI issues (README bg color, Script & Interactive info)" (#9385) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Fix https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9354 and https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9355.

1. Use a new, prescribed info text for the `Script & Interactive` tab: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9354#issuecomment-1405363060.
2. Make the code block bg color match the rest. I had to darken the comment color to avoid contrast issues.
3. Change the bg color of the README section on the upload page to be white. This fixes link contrast issues (newly discovered problem).

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add new domain for image allowlist " (#9378) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Summary of the changes (in less than 80 characters):

Add domain "caniuse.bitsofco.de" for image allowlist

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9252

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] Box around the TFM section arrows is hidden by the box below it" (#9375) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
The box around the framework generation collapsible arrows (when they're selected/in focus) is distorted by the box below it. Some of the bottom part of the box gets hidden.

# Gallery

## Changes

* https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/9360 (tracked by https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4762)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] TFM section should be expanded on page load if a TFM is selected" (#9370) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
All TFM sections are collapsed when the page loads, even if a TFM is selected, because of which users can't see their selected TFMs.

### Solution
If any individual TFMs have been selected, their TFM sections should be expanded when the page loads.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "dotnet restore behavior change from 6.0.404 to 6.0.405 in Linux" (#12431) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

dotnet SDK 6.0.405

### Worked before?

dotnet SDK 6.0.404

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

Describe the bug
dotnet SDK 6.0.405 will fail the build if the NuGet feed specified in NuGet.config cannot be reached.
The same version on Windows does not experience this behavior.
Older versions of Linux SDK also do not experience this behavior

To Reproduce
Create a new C# project without any PackageReferences
Create NuGet.config with an unreachable feed
Pin dotnet SDK to 6.0.405
Execute dotnet build
Expected:
5. Successful build

Exceptions (if any)
error NU1301: Unable to load the service index for source ...
Failed to restore *csproj

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support package asset signing during build " (#12421) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

MSBuild.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

Hello,

We want to ensure that all package asset files of all consumed packages are digital signed
so that the software supports environemnts with enabled Device-Guard (based on certifacates).

Regards,
Stefan

### Additional Context and Details

Idea:
- If package asset files are copied to the output folder we want to enrich the copy operation in a way that these files are automatically signed if necessary 
- This signing should happen before the actual target is created to ensure that the assets are always older than the created output target
- If multiple targets are sharing the output folder and using the same NuGet packages, the other targets should not replace the signed asset file in the output folder

Any suggestions?
This repo doesn't accept issues. Please see README.md in the root for more details.
This repo doesn't accept issues. Please see README.md in the root for more details.
